page.title: 16Religion.
page.content: In Tumble there are eight nonconformist chapels or churches and one church. These in the main are attended on Sunday and on other weekday evenings by members of the older generation and by children. Most services are conducted in the Welsh Language. There is a strong nonconformist tradition in the village. Four of the smaller denominations broke away from the other nonconformist denominations after the revival of 1904. The Church of Wales, (Eglwys Dewi Sant) St. David's Church has 250 members but only 40 approximately attend services there on a Sunday. Sunday School is attended by about 12 to 15 children. There is also a Mothers' Union who meet during a weekday evening. The Vicar is the Rev. John Gravell.
